commit.title: [proof] Provide better control of "open proofs" exceptions.
commit.message:
[proof] Provide better control of "open proofs" exceptions.

This is inspired and an alternative to #8981. We consolidate the "open
proof" exception, allowing clients to explicitly capture it and
removing some ugly duplicated code in the way.

In particular, we also remove some unnecessary `tclCOMPLETE` calls to
code that will actually call `close_proof`. In this case, it is better
to delegate error management to the core function.

There still remains a few users of `tclCOMPLETE/tclSOLVE` in the
codebase, and while I am not sure, it looks like they should be
removed.

Some error messages have changed [as we consolidate two error paths]
so this PR may require adjustment in that area.

commit.title: [proof] Provide better control of "open proofs" exceptions.
commit.message:
[proof] Provide better control of "open proofs" exceptions.

This is inspired and an alternative to #8981. We consolidate the "open
proof" exception, allowing clients to explicitly capture it and
removing some ugly duplicated code in the way.

In particular, we also remove some unnecessary `tclCOMPLETE` calls to
code that will actually call `close_proof`. In this case, it is better
to delegate error management to the core function.

There still remains a few users of `tclCOMPLETE/tclSOLVE` in the
codebase, and while I am not sure, it looks like they should be
removed.

Some error messages have changed [as we consolidate two error paths]
so this PR may require adjustment in that area.
